summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1471: Serperior (Black & White #6)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1471: Serperior (Black & White #6)
body:
Note: This image is of the Dragons Exalted print of the card, but the 4 prints available over the years played the same.

Serperior had a second card in the Black & White set, and this one got a bit of hype before release. It was built very similar to the other one, but its big advantage was that the heal was in Ability form and worked from the Bench. It also worked on Pokemon that weren’t Grass-type, meaning that it could work with far more partners. It still had some of the same problems in that the format had a ton of really hard-hitting Pokemon, and this fact did not change as the years went on (and this card, thanks to its reprints, was available for 5 years!), but there was a nice base to try to work with.

130 HP was pretty typical for a Stage 2 at that point. It was bulky enough to take most hits at least once, though there could be some occasional issues with the strongest of attackers. Formats with the Hypnotoxic Laser/Virbank City Gym combo could cut through Serperior much more easily, though, since that required just 100 damage to pull off when taking Royal Heal into account. The x2 Fire Weakness was a mixed bag depending on when it was played. Reshiram was a nuisance, especially earlier in the HGSS-On format. Then the Fire-type was mostly in lower-tier decks, but you did have things like Pyroar and Charizard EX popping up in the NXD-On (Next Destinies) and BCR-On (Boundaries Crossed) formats. The somewhat rare Flareon was also annoying in these later formats as well. The -20 Water Resistance was nice with the early Kingdra, Vanilluxe, and Kyurem and the later Blastoise, Kyurem (Plasma Freeze), Empoleon, and Seismitoad EX. 20 wasn’t a lot, but it could make a difference on something with constant healing. Being able to retreat for just a single Energy was quite nice indeed, especially since Serperior was more of a supporter than an attacker.

Royal Heal was Serperior’s Ability, and the thing that made it interesting in the first place. You healed 10 damage from each of your Pokemon between turns. The obvious play, especially in earlier formats, was to pair this with Reuniclus, use Reuniclus to spread damage taken among your Pokemon, and heal a bunch of it away at once. Running both stage 2 Pokemon could be a bit clunky, especially for a fast time in the game, but it could take quite a bit of abuse if it all set up.

Serperior tried to be an attacker with Leaf Tornado. 60 damage for a Grass and a Colorless Energy wasn’t terrible but also wasn’t spectacular. You could move Grass Energy around your Pokemon as you wanted when using the attack, which could make for some cool plays if you were running this with other Grass-types like Virizion (or, much later on, Virizion EX or something), but it was mostly limited to that scenario.

Serperior was just a bit too slow to seriously compete with good decks when it was available. It did make for an interesting idea for a fun deck that tried to tank for a while, but tanking just wasn’t that good until really late in Serperior’s run as a legal card and other Pokemon just did it better by then. It was a nice attempt that would have been awesome in quite a few other eras of the game to be sure. It was stuck in fun decks in reality.

blog.name: friendsafariserver
blog.title: Friend Safari!
blog.description:
Friend Safari is a SFW, OC-friendly, paragraph-style roleplay server for main series Pokémon games. From Kanto to Alola, the whole Pokémon world is your Cloyster! Members of this server are allowed a total of four played characters, with at least one required to be canonical.

The server is run by a team of five mods who you can learn more about via the mods page. We cultivate an easygoing and open atmosphere, with member comfort and happiness being our top priority.

All of the links are in the drop down menu under Rowlet, labeled Pokémon! Hovering over each Pokémon will tell you what page they link to!

summary: Welcome to the Friend Safari! Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region,...
body:
Welcome to the Friend Safari!

Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region, multiple modes for character interactions, and plenty of in-character events, ours is an active and welcoming group always looking for new members! To learn more about our server, head over to our rules!

Reblog this ad, stop by our blog and check us out!

Rules | Joining | Characters | Timeline

blog.name: tired-pokemon-boi
blog.title: It's not a Religion
blog.description:
It's Pokemon.            
Alex. He/Him. This blog only consist of Pokemon content, my fanfiction writing, my art, and so much more!

summary: Pokemon Fanfiction Chapter 6 part 1: Can we do this?
title: Pokemon Fanfiction Chapter 6 part 1: Can we do this?
body:
The rest of that evening was Alex sitting in a chair patiently waiting for the nurse to heal his Pokémon at the entrance to the nurse’s office. Luckily, the nurse had told him that Igneel only needed rest and gave him Igneel’s Pokeball after she was done bandaging him up and giving him the proper treatment, sadly however he didn’t get out until midnight. When the nurse gave him back Igneel in his Pokeball, he trudged back to the fire type dorms, opened the Pokeball to let Igneel out and put him to bed, and then crashed into his dorm bed to sleep.

The next morning Alex laid in bed and didn’t feel like getting up. He rolled over to see his little Charmander, awake and roaming around the room, chasing after the small mobile when he saw it sway slightly and starting out the window intently, as if it didn’t matter that just yesterday the small golden lizard had almost died. He looked at his Charmander and noticed the white bandages wrapped around his abdomen and the top of his head, he wondered if Igneel would have scars on his back when he was impaled by Weedle.  Alex sighed, covered his face with his blankets, and rolled back over, he was the worst trainer ever.

He totally thought he had gotten this down, but Bethany was right, simulations, which was everything he had been doing for the past two years, weren’t like actual Pokémon battles which he should’ve been practicing. He had totally forgotten about terrain, which was a huge part in that battle against Wendell and his Weedle. He had underestimated his opponent, just because he supposedly had a type advantage should not have made it easier for him to win, especially since Wendell and Weedle had tons of experience in battles. But the biggest issue wasn’t the battle itself, it was Igneel and Alex. Both had never battled before, Igneel was only three months old, heck the Charmander barely knew how to not burn things with his tail yet! Ughhhh, Alex thought to himself, I’m so stupid! He thought Pokemon battles were going to be easy, that he could handle it. But maybe he can’t. Maybe he wasn’t meant to do this. He looked up towards the ceiling, maybe his parents were right. Maybe he wasn’t fit to be a trainer. Maybe he should go back to his parents’ house and tell them that they were right, and that maybe he should give be a researcher a chance. He looked at Igneel who was now looking at him with a concerned look. Maybe I should…

Before he could finish his thoughts, there was a knock on his door. He groaned, it was probably Jose, the custodian, trying to clean his room again.

“No Jose,” Alex groaned, “My room is fine, go away please.”

There was a silence for awhile and Alex thought that maybe he was just hearing things. Then he heard a small voice, “I mean, I don’t know who Jose is. But can I come in?”

title: Goodra - 706
body:
It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that’s the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.

- Pokemon Y, Alpha Sapphire

blog.name: fidchellvore
blog.title: Fidchell's Vore Haus
blog.description: This is where my characters lounge during their time off, and they're accepting questions...Lucky you! (Read the About page before asking please.)

summary:
Coltide- the Sea colt pokemon
Type: water | ability: swift swim
Coltide live on the coast of Claravi. They are commonly referred...
body:
Coltide- the Sea colt pokemon

Type: water | ability: swift swim

Coltide live on the coast of Claravi. They are commonly referred to as the ponyta of the sea, as they are known to ferry small pokemon across the deep blue sea.

(Evolves after leveling up knowing dragon pulse)

Stalliocean- the monsoon pokemon

Type: water/dragon | ability: swift swim

These pokemon are extremely rare. They can cause devastating floods if threatened, and are very difficult to tame. Only powerful trainers can dare to mount this pokemon.

Based on the hippocampus*

trail.content:
Coltide- the Sea colt pokemon

Type: water | ability: swift swim

Coltide live on the coast of Claravi. They are commonly referred to as the ponyta of the sea, as they are known to ferry small pokemon across the deep blue sea.

(Evolves after leveling up knowing dragon pulse)

Stalliocean- the monsoon pokemon

Type: water/dragon | ability: swift swim

These pokemon are extremely rare. They can cause devastating floods if threatened, and are very difficult to tame. Only powerful trainers can dare to mount this pokemon.

Based on the hippocampus*
